Event.0: Ann Serano Lopez divorces actor and talk show host George Lopez (49) due to irreconcilable differences
Event.1: Actor Ryan Reynolds (34) and actress Scarlett Johansson (26) divorce due to irreconcilable differences after two years of marriage
Event.2: "Medium" actress Patricia Arquette (40) divorces actor Thomas Jane (39) due to irreconcilable differences after 5 years of marriage
Event.3: Iconic American motion-picture and stage actor Marlon Brando died in Los Angeles.
Event.4: The International Criminal Court—established to prosecute and adjudicate individuals accused of genocide, war crimes, and crimes against humanity—began sittings.
Event.5: NBA commences a player lockout after no agreement with players about salary issues - lasts 204 days with the season shortened by 50 games
Event.6: The crown colony of Hong Kong officially reverted to Chinese sovereignty, ending 156 years of British rule.
Event.7: United Kingdom returns Hong Kong and the New Territories to the People's Republic of China
Event.8:
Missy Elliott
American rapper and music producer
was born
Event.9: The United States, the United Kingdom, the U.S.S.R., and 59 other states signed the Nuclear Non-proliferation Treaty in an attempt to halt the spread of nuclear weapons.
Event.10: The Beatles' album "Sgt Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band" goes #1 in the United States, where it would stay for 15 weeks
Event.11: The U.S. Postal Service instituted the Zone Improvement Plan Code, commonly known as the ZIP Code.
Event.12: Bulova Watch Co pays $9 for 1st ever network TV commercial
Event.13:
Karen Black
American actress
was born
Event.14: The Communist Party of China is founded and Chen Duxiu elected its leader
Event.15:
Olivia de Havilland
American actress
was born
Event.16: First day of the Battle of the Somme: the British Army suffers its worst day, losing 19,240 men (WWI)
Event.17: Dwight Eisenhower marries Mary `Mamie' Geneva Doud in Denver, Colorado
Event.18: The first Tour de France bicycle race began.
Event.19: British admiral John Jellicoe (42) weds Gwendoline Cayzer at Holy Trinity in London
Event.20: Austrian Archduke Franz Ferdinand (36) weds countess Sophie Chotek (32) in Reichstadt, Bohemia
Event.21: The Dominion of Canada is formed, comprising the provinces of New Brunswick, Nova Scotia, Ontario & Quebec, with John A. Macdonald serving as the first Prime Minister
Event.22:
Dominion of Canada established
The Dominion of Canada was formed this day in 1867, an event subsequently celebrated as an annual Canadian holiday (its current name, Canada Day, was adopted in 1982) marked by parades, fireworks, and the display of flags.
Event.23: The Battle of Gettysburg, one of the most important battles of the American Civil War, began.
Event.24: Battle of Gettysburg, Pennsylvania; Lee's northward advance halted
Event.25: The joint reading of Charles Darwin and Alfred Russel Wallace's papers on evolution to the Linnean Society
Event.26:
Ignaz Semmelweis
German-Hungarian physician
was born
Event.27: Matsuo Basho, zen poet, leaves for 150 days journey on Honshu, Japan
Event.28:
Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz
German philosopher and mathematician
was born
Event.29: Sir Thomas More went on trial for treason for refusing to accept King Henry VIII as head of the Church of England.
